cont.entity_a: Plays multiple formats including DVDs, MPEG4, DivX, VCD, and MP3. Compatible with wide variety of disc formats. Plays JPEGs and MP3s as well.
cont.entity_b: Performs well with DVD-R and MP3 playback. Does not support non-Region 1 discs.

cont.entity_a: Nice picture quality with progressive scan. Progressive scan quality is good but not great.
cont.entity_b: Below average picture quality with high levels of pixelation.

cont.entity_a: Excellent form factor, slim and compact.
Remote is cheap and badly designed with no 'open' button. No eject button on the remote control.
cont.entity_b: Does not come with a remote control.
Navigating on-screen menus is less intuitive.

cont.entity_a: Can be easily programmed to play all region DVDs.
Good value for the price, especially for DivX capability.
Durability issues, often failing within months. Frequent freezing and playback issues reported. Some units experience mechanical clicking noises.
cont.entity_b: Durability issues with many units failing within a year. Discs began to stall and skip after two weeks. Some units experience overheating and shutting down.

cont.entity_a: Philips offers limited warranty and poor customer support. Good customer service when under warranty.
Sound quality is perfect with both analog and digital outputs.
Easy to set up and use.

cont.entity_b: Reliable performance for several years before failure. Sony products have generally been reliable.
Lacks HDMI output, avoiding handshake issues.
